triples.name: Communication protocol
triples.relevance: The survey focuses on communication-protocol-based analysis and synthesis, making protocols central to networked systems control.

triples.name: Networked control system
triples.relevance: Networked control systems are the main subject of the survey, dealing with control loops closed through communication networks.

triples.name: Control system
triples.relevance: Control systems form the theoretical foundation for the control problems and synthesis issues discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Kalman filter
triples.relevance: Filtering problems are a key topic in the survey, with Kalman filtering being a fundamental technique for state estimation.

triples.name: Stability theory
triples.relevance: Stability analysis under protocol scheduling is a major focus area of the survey for networked systems.

triples.name: Fault detection and isolation
triples.relevance: Fault diagnosis is systematically reviewed as one of the key communication-protocol-based problems in networked systems.

triples.name: Robust control
triples.relevance: Robust control addresses parameter uncertainties, which is one of the key characteristics of networked systems discussed in the survey.
